column4: Hi, does anyone know how to setup a Broadcom Corporation BCM4312 802.11b/g LP-PHY [14e4:4315] (rev 01)
I know
I followed those steps
I can connect for about 5 minutes after boot
then I lose connection, and I have to reboot
what are you using to connect with? network manager or wicd?
and you're sure network manager has been completely disabled?
by checking the process list
so wicd isn't running?
okay, then they are likely cancelling each other out - you need to run one or the other, but not both
and if you run this in a terminal:  ps axf | grep wicd
should I do a reboot?
did you find it in the ps list?
okay, you have no wicd running, it's only using networkmanager. do you have nm-applet installed?
UTP?
an iwconfig wlan0 gives wlan0     IEEE 802.11bg  ESSID:"dd-wrt"
yes.
It's working atm, I had to do a reboot. If it doesn't lose connection in a few minutes it should be solved.
I didn't really know where to start, so I think that was right after boot.
have you had a look at my pastebin?
I suppose you don't find a solution to my problem?
I'm afraid not, have you tried searching ubuntuforums.org? there's usually a lot of people using broadcom chips with issues and solutions there
